channel.title: Live TV Online
channel.description:
I found some sites where you can watch live tv online. I was wondering how they put their tv stations online? If anyone knows please let me know.
Here are some examples of what I mean: http://wwitv.com/portal.htm http://www.chooseandwatch.com/ http://freetube.us.tc/[br][size=1]Posted on: April 01, 2007, 05:36:34 PM[/size][br][size=1]Posted on: April 02, 2007, 01:06:50 PM[/size][hr]so.. does anyone know how they put tv stations online???

item.title: Live TV Online
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

PaulT:

Watching live television on the internet is like watching a movie on your iPod, or using a mouse in DOS. Sure, you could do it, but it misses the point. One of the greatest things about this era of technopornality is that we can watch whatever we want whenever we want. Let’s not watch south park, let’s just watch the part where they say niggers over and over again.

definitely the best part.

Read full topic

item.title: Live TV Online
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Gtech Warriors, post:7, topic:73572”]auright thanks…

but if i get a video card on my pc i could host tv stations?[/quote]

No, you’ll be able to pick-up a TV signal(witch is no use in the UK as we’re switching to digital) so you can watch TV on your PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Live TV Online
item.dc:creator: @Gtech_Warriors Gtech Warriors
item.description:
@Gtech_Warriors wrote:

auright thanks…

but if i get a video card on my pc i could host tv stations?

Read full topic

item.title: Live TV Online
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Gtech Warriors:

so if i wanted one of my stations thats on my tv to be on my website how would i do that?

You can’t do that directly, but I’ll try to explain as I work with a lot of media students on tuesdays and thursdays.

When you watch something live, it isn’t actually live, it’s about 5 mins slow as someone edits it in a good video editor, so basically the camera recording it sends it to some dude’s box, he edits it and feeds it to what is broadcasted to the TV. As far as I know you can’t get TV signal working on your PC unless you have a TV card.

Read full topic
